intro: Thunia xanthophlebia, commonly known as the golden feather plant, is a species of flowering plant native to the island of Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its striking, yellowish-green foliage and clusters of small, white flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in humid tropical climates. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
